div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre:
1504 Nablus (anc. Neapolis) region, Sa- maria, 1968 Burial: c. 332 B.C. (Spaer) Contents: 965+ AR. Found with jewelry Sinope: 2 dr. Amisus: 1 dr. frag. Eastern imit. of Athens: 206+ tetradr. and fr. Tyre: 131 Attic st. (as BMC 25 ff.) ANS 1969.158.1 ANS 1969.158.2 ANS 1969.157.3 ANS 1969.158.4 ANS 1969.158.3
Sidon ANS 1969.157.13 ANS 1969.157.16 , Tyre ANS 1969.157.14 ANS 1969.157.12 , new types of Cilicia ANS 1969.157.8
and Phoenicia ANS 1969.157.18 ANS 1969.157.6 ANS 1969.157.9 ANS 1969.157.7 ANS 1969.157.17 ANS 1969.157.5 ANS 1969.157.15 ANS 1969.157.4 ANS 1969.157.10 ANS 1969.157.11 : 625+ fr. Disposition: A. Spaer, Jerusalem 263+; New York 20 fr.; London 13; Oxford 13; Copenhagen 14 ANS Annual Retort 1969, p. 10 To be published by A. Spaer and Silvia Hurter For the date of the Tyrian staters see no. 1502 above
